alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 11:50AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of Duck Creek and it`s tributaries is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1136 AM EDT, gauge reports indicated the Duck Creek at Whipple was about a half of a foot above bankfull, and appeared to be going into crest. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly along it and it`s tributaries within the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain fell on Friday in and upstream of the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marietta. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
